009
010package imagingbook.spectral.fd;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014
015/**
016 * @version 2020/04/01
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public class PolygonSampler {
021        
022        public PolygonSampler() {
023        }
024        
025        /**
026         * Samples the closed polygon path specified by V at M
027         * equi-distant positions. 
028         * @param V the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
029         * @param M the number of sample points.
030         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
031         */
032        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygonUniformly(Pnt2d[] V, int M) {
033                int N = V.length;
034                double Delta = pathLength(V) / M;       // constant segment length in Q
035                // distribute N points along polygon path P
036                Pnt2d[] S = new Pnt2d[M];
037//              S[0] = (Point) V[0].clone();    // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
038                S[0] = PntDouble.from(V[0]);            // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
039                int i = 0;                      // lower index of segment (i,i+1) in P
040                int j = 1;                      // index of next point to be added to Q
041                double alpha = 0;       // lower boundary of current path segment in P
042                double beta = Delta;    // path position of next point to be added to Q
043                // for all M segments in P do:
044                while (i < N && j < M) {
045                        Pnt2d vA = V[i];
046                        Pnt2d vB = V[(i + 1) % N];
047                        double delta = vA.distance(vB);
048                        // handle segment (i,i+1) with path boundaries (a,a+d), knowing a < b
049                        while (beta <= alpha + delta && j < M) {
050                                // a < b <= a+d
051                                S[j] = interpolate(vA, vB, (beta - alpha) / delta);
052                                j = j + 1;
053                                beta = beta + Delta;
054                        }
055                        alpha = alpha + delta;
056                        i = i + 1;
057                }       
058                return S;
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * This is for testing: allows to choose an arbitrary start point by
063         * setting 'startFrac' in [0,1].
064         * @param V the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
065         * @param M the number of sample points.
066         * @param startFrac the position of the first sample as a fraction of the 
067         * polggon's circumference in [0,1].
068         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
069         */
070        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygonUniformly(Pnt2d[] V, int M, double startFrac) {
071                int startPos = (int) Math.round(V.length * startFrac) % V.length;
072                return samplePolygonUniformly(shiftLeft(V, startPos), M);
073        }
074        
075        private Pnt2d[] shiftLeft(Pnt2d[] V, int startPos) {
076                int polyLen = V.length;
077                Pnt2d[] P2 = new Pnt2d[polyLen]; 
078                for (int i = 0; i < P2.length; i++) {
079//                      P2[i] = (Point) V[(i + startPos) % polyLen].clone();
080                        P2[i] = PntDouble.from(V[(i + startPos) % polyLen]);
081                }
082                return P2;
083        }
084        
085        
086        protected double pathLength(Pnt2d[] V) {
087                double L = 0;
088                final int N = V.length;
089                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
090                        Pnt2d p0 = V[i];
091                        Pnt2d p1 = V[(i + 1) % N];
092                        L = L + p0.distance(p1);
093                }
094                return L;
095        }
096        
097        protected Pnt2d interpolate(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1, double alpha) {
098                // alpha is in [0,1]
099                double x = p0.getX() + alpha * (p1.getX() - p0.getX());
100                double y = p0.getY() + alpha * (p1.getY() - p0.getY());
101                return Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(x, y);
102        }
103        
104}
